required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of CP-751,871 In Combination With Cisplatin And Gemcitabine In Chemotherapy-Na√Øve Patients With Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Dose Escalation Study Of CP-751,871 In Combination With Cisplatin And Gemcitabine In Previously Untreated Patients With Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: CP 751,871 is a fully human monoclonal antibody against the Insulin-Like Growth Factor 1 Receptor (IGF-1R). Preclinical and clinical data indicate that CP 751,871 augments the anti-tumor activity of chemotherapy. This study will identify the Maximal Tolerated Dose of CP 751,871 (or the Maximal Feasible Dose) in combination with standard gemcitabine-cisplatin chemotherapy for the treatment of advanced Non-Small Cell Lung cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose-limiting Toxicities (DLT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of treatment up to end of Cycle 1, Day 21
primary_outcome.description: Cycle 1 figitumumab attributed: Grade (Gr) 4 neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count <500 cells/cubic millimeter [mm^3]) >=7 days, febrile neutropenia (Gr 3, fever >=38.5 degrees Celsius), neutropenic infection (Gr 3 neutropenia, infection); Gr 4 thrombocytopenia (platelet <25,000 cells/mm^3), Gr 3 thrombocytopenia >=7 days/bleeding; other Gr 3 not blood/bone marrow Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events bar gastrointestinal toxicity, treatment-managed hyperglycemia/fatigue, hypersensitivity; Gr 3-4 hyperglycemia despite treatment; fail to adequately recover to continue study treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration at the End of Infusion (Cinf) for Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 for dose escalation and Cycle 4 for dose expansion
secondary_outcome.description: Figitumumab pharmacokinetic (PK) data was analyzed using noncompartmental methods

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 1, 24, 72, 168, 336, 504 hr in Cycle 1 for dose escation and 0 (pre-dose), 1, 24, 72, 168, 336, 504 hr in Cycle 4 for expansion
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast). Figitumumab PK data was analyzed using noncompartmental methods

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum Observed Plasma Trough Concentration (Cmin) for Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration at the end of Cycle 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) for Cisplatin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 1.917, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 24 hr on Cycle 1, Day 1 and Cycle 2, Day 1 for cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 and 0 (pre-dose), 0.917, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 23 hr on Cycle 1, Day 1 and Cycle 2, Day 1 for cisplatin 80 mg/m^2
secondary_outcome.description: Cisplatin PK data was analyzed using noncompartmental methods. Plasma exposure parameters for cisplatin were analyzed in the absence (Cycle 1) and presence of (Cycle 2) figitumumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for Cisplatin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 1.917, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 24 hr on Cycle 1, Day 1 and Cycle 2, Day 1 for cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 and 0 (pre-dose), 0.917, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 23 hr on Cycle 1, Day 1 and Cycle 2, Day 1 for cisplatin 80 mg/m^2
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast). Cisplatin PK data was analyzed using noncompartmental methods. Plasma exposure parameters for cisplatin were analyzed in the absence (Cycle 1) and presence (Cycle 2) of figitumumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) for Gemcitabine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 0.417, 1, 1.5, 2.5, 3.5 hr on Cycle 1, Day 1 and Cycle 2, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: Gemcitabine PK data was analyzed using noncompartmental methods. Plasma exposure parameters for gemcitabine were analyzed in the absence (Cycle) 1 and presence (Cycle 2) of figitumumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for Gemcitabine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 (pre-dose), 0.417, 1, 1.5, 2.5, 3.5 hr on Cycle 1, Day 1 and Cycle 2, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast). Gemcitabine PK data was analyzed using noncompartmental methods. Plasma exposure parameters for gemcitabine were analyzed in the absence (Cycle 1) and presence (Cycle 2) of figitumumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) for Pemetrexed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 0.167, 1.167, 2.167, 4.167, 6.167, 24.167 hr on Cycle 1, Day 1 and Cycle 2, Day 1 for pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2
secondary_outcome.description: Pemetrexed PK data was analyzed using noncompartmental methods. Plasma exposure parameters for pemetrexed were analyzed in the absence (Cycle 1) and presence (Cycle 2) of figitumumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for Pemetrexed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 0.167, 1.167, 2.167, 4.167, 6.167, 24.167 hr on Cycle 1, Day 1 and Cycle 2, Day 1 for pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast). Pemetrexed PK data was analyzed using noncompartmental methods. Plasma exposure parameters for pemetrexed were analyzed in the absence (Cycle 1) and presence (Cycle 2) of figitumumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response or Prolonged Stabilization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, from Cycle 2 onwards computerized tomography (CT) scan done within 7-10 days prior to next cycle (approximately Day 15 of each cycle), follow-up (30 days after last study treatment dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with a confirmed complete response (CR), confirmed partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) for at least 12 weeks on study according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Participants with non measurable disease were considered having a clinical benefit response only in the case of achievement of CR. Participants who developed early progressive disease post dosing and prior to response evaluation were considered to have progressed on study. Confirmed responses were those that persisted on repeat imaging >= 4 weeks after initial response

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, from Cycle 2 onwards CT scan done within 7-10 days prior to next cycle (approximately Day 15 of each cycle), follow-up (30 days after last study treatment dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the date of enrollment to date of documented disease progression, or death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, from Cycle 2 onwards CT scan done within 7-10 days prior to next cycle (approximately Day 15 of each cycle), follow-up (30 days after last study treatment dose)
secondary_outcome.description: For responding patients (CR and PR): Time from the date that CR or PR was first recorded to the date of the first documentation of progression

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Blood Anti-drug Antibody (ADA) Specific for Figitumumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 min prior to figitumumab infusion in Cycle 1 and Cycle 4, end of study, fourth follow up visit (approximately 150 days after last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with positive total or neutralizing anti-drug antibody (ADA) for figitumumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Total Circulating Insulin-like Growth Factor (IGF-1) Levels
secondary_outcome.description: To monitor serum total IGF-1 levels as a potential pharmacodynamic response to figitumumab treatment

other_outcome.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose level below the maximum administered dose which caused 0 or 1 out of 6 participants to experience a DLT in that given cohort at Cycle 1

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of dose escalation, which was assessed in the last participant of the dose escalation portion of the study in Month 19
other_outcome.description: The RP2D was determined after review and discussion by sponsor and investigators of the study data. Consideration was given to type and severity of toxicity as well as clinical suitability for long-term administration

intervention.description: CP-751,871 at doses ranging from 6 to 20 mg/Kg on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle. CP-751,871 may be administered even after active comparators discontinuation, for a total number of 17 cycles (1 year).
Cisplatin 75* mg/m2 or 80* mg/m2, IV on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycles. * 75 mg/m2 when in combination with pemetrexed, 80 mg/m2 when in combination with gemcitabine
Gemcitabine 1250 mg/m2, IV on Days 1 and 8 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycles
Pemetrexed 500 mg/m2, IV on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically proven diagnosis of Stage IIIB (N3 and/or T4) or Stage IV Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer in patients 18-year-old or older, with Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1 not amenable to curative surgery or radiation therapy and an adequate organ function (bone marrow, hepatic, renal, and cardiac) within 14 days prior to enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any prior treatment for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer including chemotherapy, biologic response modifiers or therapy with any investigational agents.
- Patients with known brain metastases, spinal cord compression, uncontrolled superior vein cava syndrome or carcinomatous meningitis.
- Patients with gastrointestinal abnormalities including active gastrointestinal bleeding, pre-diabetes (pre-fasting glycemia > 120 g/dL and/or glycosylate haemoglobin level > 7.5%), known HIV or AIDS-related illness, significant active cardiac disease or receiving chronic steroid therapy or concurrent use of growth hormones or growth hormone inhibitors or aminoglycoside antibiotics should be excluded from the study.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Figitumumab 6 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab 6 milligram (mg)/kilogram (kg) was administered intravenously (IV) on Day 1 of each cycle over 2.5 hours (hr) up to 6 cycles. Gemcitabine 1250 mg/meter square (m^2) was administered IV over approximately 30 minutes (min) on Day 1 and Day 8 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycles. Cisplatin 80 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 1 hr, following the completion of the gemcitabine treatment on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles.

group.title: Figitumumab 10 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab 10 mg/kg was administered IV on Day 1 of each cycle over 2.5 hr up to 6 cycles. Gemcitabine 1250 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 30 min on Day 1 and Day 8 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycles. Cisplatin 80 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 1 hr, following the completion of the gemcitabine treatment on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg Dose Escalation
group.description: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg, was administered IV on Day 1 of each cycle over 2.5 hr up to 6 cycles. Gemcitabine 1250 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 30 min on Day 1 and Day 8 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycles. Cisplatin 80 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 1 hr, following the completion of the gemcitabine treatment on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg RP2D Expansion 1.0 Infusion
group.description: The recommended phase 2 dose (R2PD) of figitumumab 20 mg/kg was administered IV 24 hr after start of cisplatin infusion in Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of each cycle thereafter over 1 hr up to 17 cycles. Gemcitabine 1250 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 30 min on Day 1 and Day 8 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycles. Cisplatin 80 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 1 hr, following the completion of the gemcitabine treatment on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg RP2D Expansion 2.5 Infusion
group.description: The RP2D of figitumumab 20 mg/kg was administered IV 24 hr after start of cisplatin infusion in Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of each cycle thereafter over 2.5 hr up to 17 cycles. Gemcitabine 1250 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 30 min on Day 1 and Day 8 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycles. Cisplatin 80 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 1 hr, following the completion of the gemcitabine treatment on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg Pemetrexed Expansion
group.description: The RP2D of figitumumab 20 mg/kg, was administered IV 24 hr after start of cisplatin infusion in Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of each cycle thereafter over 2.5 hr up to 17 cycles. Pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 was administered IV over 10 min on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle up to 6 cycles. Cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 was administered IV over approximately 2 hr, following the completion of the pemetrexed treatment on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Participants who received figitumumab 6, 10, 20 mg/kg and at the RP2D of 20 mg/kg with increasing infusion rates in combination with standard doses of gemcitabine and cisplatin. Participants who received figitumumab at the RP2D in combination with pemetrexed and cisplatin.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response or Prolonged Stabilization
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with a confirmed complete response (CR), confirmed partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) for at least 12 weeks on study according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Participants with non measurable disease were considered having a clinical benefit response only in the case of achievement of CR. Participants who developed early progressive disease post dosing and prior to response evaluation were considered to have progressed on study. Confirmed responses were those that persisted on repeat imaging >= 4 weeks after initial response
outcome.time_frame: Screening, from Cycle 2 onwards computerized tomography (CT) scan done within 7-10 days prior to next cycle (approximately Day 15 of each cycle), follow-up (30 days after last study treatment dose)
outcome.population: Efficacy analysis set: All participants with measurable disease at baseline, receiving at lesast 1 dose of figitumumab with a response assessment made by the investigator according to the RECIST system.

group.title: Overall Population
group.description: Participants who received figitumumab 6, 10, 20 mg/kg and at the RP2D of 20 mg/kg with increasing infusion rates in combination with standard doses of gemcitabine and cisplatin. Participants who received figitumumab at the RP2D in combination with pemetrexed and cisplatin.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg With Gemcitabine and Cisplatin
group.description: The RP2D of figitumumab 20 mg/kg was administered IV 24 hr after start of cisplatin infusion in Cycle 1 and on Day 1 of each cycle thereafter over 2.5 to 1 hr up to 17 cycles. outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Time from the date of enrollment to date of documented disease progression, or death due to any cause
outcome.time_frame: Screening, from Cycle 2 onwards CT scan done within 7-10 days prior to next cycle (approximately Day 15 of each cycle), follow-up (30 days after last study treatment dose)
outcome.population: Efficacy analysis set: All participants with measurable disease at baseline, receiving at lesast 1 dose of figitumumab with a response assessment made by the investigator according to the RECIST system.

group.title: Overall Population

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: Time from the date of enrollment to date of documented disease progression, or death due to any cause
measure.population: Efficacy analysis set: All participants with measurable disease at baseline, receiving at lesast 1 dose of figitumumab with a response assessment made by the investigator according to the RECIST system.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR)
outcome.description: For responding patients (CR and PR): Time from the date that CR or PR was first recorded to the date of the first documentation of progression
outcome.time_frame: Screening, from Cycle 2 onwards CT scan done within 7-10 days prior to next cycle (approximately Day 15 of each cycle), follow-up (30 days after last study treatment dose)
outcome.population: No analysis of this parameter was performed. Due to the exploratory nature of the study, the analysis of the efficacy of figitumumab was limited to the assessment of clinical benefit response and PFS.

group.title: Overall Population With PR and CR
group.description: Participants with PR and CR who received figitumumab 6, 10, 20 mg/kg and at the RP2D of 20 mg/kg with increasing infusion rates in combination with standard doses of gemcitabine and cisplatin. Participants with PR and CR who received figitumumab at the RP2D in combination with pemetrexed and cisplatin.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DR)
measure.description: For responding patients (CR and PR): Time from the date that CR or PR was first recorded to the date of the first documentation of progression
measure.population: No analysis of this parameter was performed. Due to the exploratory nature of the study, the analysis of the efficacy of figitumumab was limited to the assessment of clinical benefit response and PFS.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Blood Anti-drug Antibody (ADA) Specific for Figitumumab
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with positive total or neutralizing anti-drug antibody (ADA) for figitumumab
outcome.time_frame: 30 min prior to figitumumab infusion in Cycle 1 and Cycle 4, end of study, fourth follow up visit (approximately 150 days after last dose)
outcome.population: ADA analysis set: All enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.description: To monitor serum total IGF-1 levels as a potential pharmacodynamic response to figitumumab treatment

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD)
outcome.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose level below the maximum administered dose which caused 0 or 1 out of 6 participants to experience a DLT in that given cohort at Cycle 1
outcome.population: Safety analysis set: All enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Overall Population
group.description: Participants who received figitumumab 6, 10, 20 mg/kg and at the RP2D of 20 mg/kg with increasing infusion rates in combination with standard doses of gemcitabine and cisplatin. Participants who received figitumumab at the RP2D in combination with pemetrexed and cisplatin.

measure.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD)
measure.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose level below the maximum administered dose which caused 0 or 1 out of 6 participants to experience a DLT in that given cohort at Cycle 1
measure.population: Safety analysis set: All enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D)
outcome.description: The RP2D was determined after review and discussion by sponsor and investigators of the study data. Consideration was given to type and severity of toxicity as well as clinical suitability for long-term administration
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of dose escalation, which was assessed in the last participant of the dose escalation portion of the study in Month 19
outcome.population: Safety analysis set: All enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Overall Participapnts

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment-emergent adverse events (AE) were reported from the time of the first dose of study treatment up to 150 days after the last dose of study treatment.
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a serious AE (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: A total of 46 patients were enrolled in this study but only 45 of them were evaluable because 1 patient was enrolled but did not participate due to early symptomatic deterioration prior to starting treatment.
